Lots of flavour in both the meat and sauces.
The only down side was the lack of customers let down the atmosphere but we were there at 4.30 in the afternoon so no wonder but was getting busy when we left.
Definitely will be back

What a little hidden gem. Will definitely be going  back here on our next trip to London. Staff were wonderful. Food was out of this world. Ive never tasted prawns as good as this restaurant!! Would 100% recommend Kazan to anyone looking for pre theatre dinner or dinner.

We absolutely loved our visit to Gloria! The service from entering the front door was brilliant, we all felt very well looked after during our visit. The food was the best Ive eaten in a while - our waiter recommended the truffle pasta and thank goodness because it was amazing! I mean it all was, but that dish in particular was delicious.\\nI really couldnt fault our visit. I will be recommending Gloria to others and will definitely be back myself!

Fun and delicious dining experience! All staff were friendly and welcoming to us and our little dog. (Dogs welcome on ground floor, not downstairs.) Excellent service from Carlo our waiter. Beautiful restaurant, cultivating a relaxed, informal atmosphere in a luxurious setting fit for a special occasion. Don‚Äôt expect to stay all evening - bookings are for timed slots to manage the demand.

The service was perfect here. Attentive, warm, and quick. The food was amazing, the atmosphere excellent and cozy, and the drinks simply superb. Definitely recommend a stop. If you‚Äôre lucky enough to get Davide as your server you‚Äôll be especially happy with the decision. @management keep up whatever you‚Äôre doing if every member of your wait staff is like this guy!

have genuinely eaten at almost all of the 50 or so curry houses on brick lane and can confidently say this is the best one. every place tries to convince you that theirs is - but this genuinely is. you dont come out smelling like curry, the food is great. if youre a tourist and you want to try one of the famous brick lane curries - this is where you go\\n\\n- update. Ive still been coming here, this is two years later. Remains the best curry house on brick Lane and probably London. Sahim is an A* waiter. 10/10, genuinely cares about his guests.

Really great meal here, did some research for top curry houses on brick lane and this was mentioned. Food was absolutely delicious and so filling. Great value for money, really enjoyed it. Staff were really friendly, would definitely come back.

I personally love curry and beer. I turn up to this establishment whom promise a curry and a beer and am treated to perfection by our glorious host R Ali. Poppadoms were on point. Curry was delicious and the beer was very beery. Will be attending again.
Helpful friendly staff. Amazing food. I will be back
just had the most amazing flavour explosion courtesy of the vegan shwarma. Thanks Felafel Feast!
Lovely place. Heavy on ambience and the guys really knew there stuff

We were drawn in by the delicious window display and the amazing staff. The staff made us feel like guests rather than customers due to their rearrangement of the chairs & tables to fit 5 of us in a small space during a busy afternoon. We could‚Äôve easily gone somewhere else, but it‚Äôs like a friend who doesn‚Äôt let you do anything and takes care of you completely. They were so attentive, polite and genuine.\\nThe food is also amazing ü§©üòã
Great cafe. We always like the cafe, the cakes and people there. Just recently, we realised it has renovated this place even better. Nice ambiance and even better food now.
Visited caffe with my son few days ago! Blown away by food and customer service. Italian lady made visit very pleasant. Big 5*
What a great place. Super friendly owners with great food. We had six tapas dishes from a very varied menu. I simply couldnt ask for anything else. You really feel like a valued customer.

Had a bottle of wine and tapas on a Friday night. Very welcoming staff and the wine was great. We had 8 plates of tapas to share and a few were very below standard. The olives and calamari were really not good but we enjoyed the Spanish omelette and chorizo. We were also given free fruit and shots at the end which was nice.
Nice environment in the restaurant. Genuine service that look after you with just the right amount of attention when needed. Great food. Reasonable prices too.

Amazing experience at Double J‚Äôs cafe! The staff are really nice and welcoming! I‚Äôve been to london 3x and did not find this hidden gem till now. Very affordable prices but even more amazing flavor of food! Love this place will keep coming back for more.

Absolute gem in London! What a find  excellent food, excellent service and great price, such a welcoming place and friendly staff. You know its good when you leave and there is a queue. Thank you so much for a fab breakfast to get our day started. The kids took away what they couldnt manage, because its a large serving, in a box and had it for supper!

Great little spot. Fairly priced with generous portions. The food is well presented also. Service can be a bit slow but I suppose its because they were super busy the day I visited. I would return here.

My wife has a difficult time finding decent gluten free options. I researched this place long before our trip, and was anxious to try it, hoping she would enjoy it.\\n\\nNiche surpassed all of my expectations. My wife nearly cried after her first gluten-free beer in years. The fried chicken appetizer was spectacular. I had the shirt rib main which I thought was delicious and perfectly seasoned. Top quality food all around.\\n\\nI did not get the names of either of the staff that helped us, but they were incredibly friendly and charismatic.\\n\\nEven if youre not in need of gluten free food, I recommend trying Niche. The food is that good.

6 stars. Could not fault this place one single bit from the second we stepped in. Everything from the food to the service was impeccable, every single mouthful was an explosion of flavour. The presentation of the food was absolutely beautiful. Timings between food servings were absolutely spot on to allow the taste buds to refresh for a brand new palate. A true fine-dining experience.
Heaven for celiac and gluten  intolerance people. Must visit!!!

I visited here last year and then came again for  my family and friends for dinner last night, and it was fantastic from start to finish. The service is wonderful and personable - The owner Giuseppe made a real fuss of my parents throughout the night and made sure all the tables were well looked after. They make their pasta fresh every day and it was delicious- and the pizza is the reason I came from other recommendations (best pizza in SW London!) It has an authentic Italian feel with a lovely intimate charm- I‚Äôll definitely be back.

This is our new favourite local. The food is truly excellent and staff are incredibly helpful and attentive. Always worth a visit and so glad we live so close! FYI the pesto is the best Ive ever had...

Caminata is mine and my boyfriend Mark‚Äôs favourite place to go - the food and the staff are absolutely amazing! We honestly can‚Äôt recommend this restaurant enough. We returned this evening and Giuseppe looked after us so well! No doubt we will be back again next week. If you‚Äôre in Balham or visiting you have to go - you definitely won‚Äôt be disappointed!

Extremely disappointed for a 10 person birthday dinner where everything had been arranged beforehand. Lackluster food, entirely uncoordinated (20 minute wait been mains arriving for different people), negligible service, very expensive relative to quality. The set menu is more expensive than ordering the same things a la carte. Do not recommend at all.

I celebrated my 40th birthday here with all my close friends. The food, drinks and service was simply amazing! The staff are so attentive, polite and super-efficient. They made sure all my guests were well looked after, refilling their drinks promptly and kept the food coming. Thank you so much Roland, Kenneth and the team!

Double standards and Very Proud. Inattentive treatment to customers only looking for desert and drinks at the bar.\\n\\nBeen here for food before. Not the best Japanese fusion food, and it‚Äôs over priced. However, the desert was definitely one of the best I have tried in this area. A shame.

This food was absolutely amazing. This one goes to my best from the area in taste, portions, and price. By itself, it is still great Nepalese food.\\n\\nAlso, it arrived very quickly with a good delivery, and did so on a January 1st!\\n\\nWe will definitely keep ordering from this restaurant. Great dinner!

First time trying Nepalese food and I was well impressed.\\n\\nThis place is definitely a hidden gem, amazing staff offering great service and the food was brilliant with great quality and taste.\\n\\nThe restaurant is very well presented showing the Nepalese culture with great ambience.\\n\\nI would highly recommend this restaurant they offer great customer service and amazing food. A must try !

What a fantastic restaurant, spoilt for choices on their menu. Our waiter and the owner were so attentive and really appreciate their effort - just added to the wonderful food.\\n\\nLoved the special drink they made for us at the end of our meal üòÑ\\n\\nWill be coming back as soon as we‚Äôre in the area
Nice place, the catalan sommelier gave us some great recommandations

Went to this restaurant for the first time last Saturday with my daughter. She has gluten intolerance and all the other restaurants either didnt cater for her allergy or warned it could be contaminated. Terra Rossa was happy to accommodate. The food was brilliant. Loads of choice if your vegetarian or vegan. Well cooked and good atmosphere. Will go again.

One of the best Italian restaurants Ive been to in London. Lovely ambiance (not too loud), friendly and attentive service alongside truly delicious food. They had a specific gluten free menu which was an added bonus and not something you see a lot of in Italian restaurants. Cant wait to return - thanks for a great night.
Fantastic fresh pasta, quality ingredients, and wine, time and time again. The staff is welcoming and great with children too. Will keep enjoying and supporting this local family-owned business.

Stumbled upon this place after a train cancellation took us on a different route to a restaurant we had already booked but were now too late for.Well what a stroke of luck! We LOVED it!! Fantastic food and service at very reasonable prices. We had 3 courses, wine and cocktails. The staff were super friendly. Highly recommend a visit, we will definitely be back!!‚ù§Ô∏è

Super delighted with this place!! We came here on the 8th of March with my boyfriend for a short lunch. The waiter was extremely friendly and provided excellent service. He greeted us and gave us the menus. We ordered typical Italian dishes - vegetarian risotto and aubergine spaghetti. We received complimentary bread with butter which was a nice touch. Both of the main dishes were finger licking. We even received black pepper and parmigiana from the waiter just like they do in Italy. The service and the food in this place is immaculate. We both left full and very satisfied from this restaurant experience. Worth the visit!! Will visit again üòçüòä
Went for dinner with friends. Found the place accidentally and was more than impressed. The food is amazing! The service was impeccable and so friendly. Love this place! Will come again!

Not sure how to review this place. On the one hand weve been religiously coming here for about 3 years since it opened, twice or so a year. The quality and price and service is what kept us coming back. After tonight I felt like all 3 have been downgraded. I still would recommend to come here, the food, setting, and service are still very good. Just not what it used to be. Firstly the meal deal price has gone up by ¬£10 to ¬£35 and It is now cheaper to just make your own three course meal (which kind of defeats the point of the set meal deal). The service is very good still and the waiters are polite , although the tonight we had to ask multiple times for things before they came to and the lead waitress was polite but with a bit of \Im doing you a favour\" back talk kind of vibe which by the end of the night was becoming annoying. But the worst was that the food was too salty. Not like scream salty but noticeably salty. I didnt finish my starter or main because it was too salty. I would still recommend this place to people because maybe it was a one off
column6: but its probably the last time for me. I put 5 stars because over the years this place was great to us and the family so I think it totally deserves 5 stars :)"

text: Simply outstanding food. The fish soup was heavenly. I have no words for the creamy creme brulee. Impeccable, friendly service - and the place has this lovely Paris-meets-London effortless vibe. Highly recommended - a true gem in an area that doesnt have many truly good restaurants.

A nice dining room and great service. The staff really worked well as a team.\\nMy steak was perfectly cooked though not the tastiest Ive eaten. Not cheap though; my ¬£25 steak & glass of wine, ended up costing ¬£46 once I added a second glass of wine, bottle of water and a coffee. Still, its a really nice place.

A true GEM in the heart of London.\\nEvery time I visit London, Alexandrie tops my list of outings. Be it for lunch or dinner, the QUALITY of food and SUPERB service go hand-in-hand unwaveringly. I STRONGLY recommend it for everyone who wants to try a different and excellent cuisine.

The best restaurant I went to during my trip to London. Everything perfect! From the service to the food! My boyfriend and I shared a lamb which quietly satiated both of us (we just ordered an extra mashed potato)\n\nMagnificent restaurant
A real gem with excellent food and service. The lamb shank is their most popular dish, for good reason. The tasting menu is unbeatable value.

Food was some of the best I have had in London. Ordered four drinks, appetizer, and two entrees and bill was a lot cheaper than what you would expect.\\nAlso the staff here are amazing! I can tell they enjoy and are very passionate about their jobs!\\n100% recommended and 100% worth the price.

We had a wonderful evening last night. We met an old friend who lives nearby the restaurant. The food was excellent and the house red was one of the nicest wines I have tasted for a long time. The evening was made even more special when our son and his two children arrived unexpectedly and the restaurant staff immediately accommodated them by adding another table alongside ours, all this done with a smile on a busy Saturday evening. We will certainly go back again.

Excellent bistro. Unpromising location but delivered a real bistro experience. Excellent steak in particular and berry good wines by the glass. Far better than you normally get. Will definitely go back.

Every dish was delicious. My friends and I tried vegetarian dishes as well as lamb and chicken. Every mouthful was exquisite. The waiters were so helpful, kind and so nice. This is the 2nd time l I have been here and would recommend this place time and time again.

Incredible food, incredible people. Absolutely fantastic food, so full of flavour, excellent range of meat and veggie dishes and packs a great kick when you want it to.  Portion sizes are very filling. Staff are so incredibly kind, gracious and welcoming, always happy to see you. Couldnt recommend them more.
The food and the hospitality is just brilliant! Been here a few times and the quality of the food and the service has always been great! Great atmosphere too.

I have been to several 1* restaurants and Myrtle is way better than nearly all of them. Flavours are simply sensational, neat ambient and bright venue, service is top-notch without being too formal. At lunch you will also have the chance to choose a great value fixed set menu. Fairly quiet atmosphere so it feels like you have landed on another world. A tasting menu is highly recommended for anniversaries or a meal with a very special person.
Just came from eating at Volare!!! The best pizza in London. It was the most delicious pizza I‚Äôve ever had and the staff were all so friendly. Will definitely go back and recommend!

Ive dined here many times and every meal has consistently exceeded my expectations (not that my expectations are ever low when it comes to this restaurant). A couple of weeks ago, I brought a friend here for her birthday, and Karim was our server. Let me emphasize, the food is so delicious that I wouldnt care who brought it to me. But Karim ensured our evening was special, taking the time to pair a wine for me, finding my friend the perfect cocktail, and bringing out her dessert with a candle. As someone who has served and worked in restaurant most of her life, these actions were noted and deeply appreciated. I could write an essay about how amazing the menu is here, every dish has perfectly balanced ingredients that are respectful to its origins while simultaneously introducing you to something new. The chefs knowledge, expertise, and passion shines through every bite and Im so happy I get to experience this.

WOW. Initially intended to go to Gloria (just around the corner), yet unsurprisingly it was fully booked. Arrived to this place and I have to say it went way above my expectations. Waited a few minutes to get a seat but once the food started flowing - oh wow. Beautiful flavours, sequence of dishes thoroughly thought of and the cherry on top was the prime view to the kitchen and the platting was happening just right in front of your eyes. What a wholesome way to experience food. Congrats! Keep up the good work

Nothing but respect and admiration for John and his team. The food is cooked with passion and will blow you away. Id recommend booking the kitchen bar, so you can watch the theatre unfold in front of your eyes. One moves they all move, instinctively as a team. This isnt by mistake, this is a well-rehired play for you the customer. If youre unfamiliar with the wine list or food, just ask they couldnt be more helpful.\\nAlso, ask John about his cookbook!\\nYour struggle to find better food and a better vibe in London. üëè
Top quality meat. Very friendly staff and incredible value for money. Super recommended

Excellent food and place. We had a great time and all the staff was very nice. It‚Äôs too bad there were only 2 waiters on a full Tuesday night. So it took long to order. But the rest e everything was amazing.
Good food reasonable portions.  Expensive prices but excellent table service quick and knowledgeable and friendly.  Wine list good too.

The food and staff were fantastic. Small menu means great quality and quick service too! We had a slight  problem with one of the dishes which was dealt with so well by the staff and had no ill effects to our meal as was replace within minutes. I cant fault this place and highly recommend

Absolutely delicious steak at a very reasonable price. Gotta love restaurants that just do a few things and do them extremely well.\\n\\nWe had the bavette and the classic flat iron and both were cooked exactly right, served on very cool brick plates, with fun little clever knives (which apparently are often stolen! Who does that??)\\n\\nSides were great too - especially the mushroom sauce and aubergine.\\n\\nThe interior is gorgeous and the popcorn and chocolate ice cream to finish is just an extra hint of smart ownership. People love an extra. Nice work!

Rocky start, order wasn‚Äôt handled well and our food came out wrong but my god was it rectified well. I really appreciate it, food was quickly fixed and the staff were so helpful in making our experience turn around. That is what hospitality is all about, taking care of people. Thank you very much gang

Absolute Gem\\n\\nVisited Myrtles on a Saturday night.  This was a birthday treat for me as I had wanted to visit for a long time.  From the moment we entered Daniel and the team made us feel so welcome and at ease.  My wife and I had the tasting menu, and with each course came a story of the food and where it was from, which added to the whole evening.   Juts a delightful experience from start to finish.  Never rushed and nothing pretentious about this restaurant.  Probably the best food I have ever eaten.  We will return soon.
Wonderful dinner ! impeccable service, outstanding food (I had the beets, duck, and chocolate mousse) , this place is a rare gem. High quality ingredients and careful craft. Highly recommend
Time Out magazine was SO right in suggesting this as worthy visiting. Me and my friend had two delicious mains, with plenty of \satellite dishes\" AKA sides
column6: an it was worth every penny. Down-to-earth eating place
column8: attentive and very kind staff. Ill be back

text: Discovered this place a few years ago and was very pleased with the food quality and value for money.\\nGot a big shock a few weeks ago (Jan 22) when I ordered a meal for collection.\\nWhen I arrived to collect the order, I was shocked to be presented with a ¬£49 bill for an order which not long ago was in the high ¬£20s.\\n\\nStaff explained how much their own costs had gone up but when I made the order there was an opportunity to tell me that their prices had increased by that much, giving me the opportunity to make a decision on how to proceed. This never happened.\\n\\nAdding insult to injury, the food was dry and the chicken tough.\\n\\nBe honest, be open and ill respect you.
Hands down my favourite restaurant in London. You just cant resist it. Absolutely worth it.
Top quality Italian food in this discreet neighbourhood local. Nothing flashy, but great flavours in simple, but traditional, cuisine. Fantastic service, too.

Would frequent if I lived nearby. Heard the waitress telling about a couple that are regulars every Friday for the last 10 years. The food was delicious. Visit for our anniversary. Even mentioned in the booking. Nothing special or a dessert on the house tho. The pasta from the valentines menu with langoustine was yummy. Desserts were so light and creamy.Overall will make a 1 and half hour journey to come back again.
Very nice atmosphere and delicious food. Went there to collect an order. We were impressed with the quality of the food we received, authentic taste and reasonably priced.

Best pizza! We eat here regularly, and now that they have moved one door down theres so much room. Prices are fair, there are different options for everyone and good range of drinks.\\n\\nAlso to add, its a great place to take non-vegans as the pizzas are delicious and everyone Ive taken has been impressed :)

Love Purezza!\\nI come here with my Dad quite a lot when were in London and it never disappoints.\\nWent again on Friday and as ever the food was on point and the manager and all the other staff are really friendly and lovely.\\nMy personal fave is definitely the calzone and I feel like I could literally just live off that for the rest of my life if I could..\\nAlthough I know all the other food is amazing as well, including the deserts.\\nIt seems to be a very well managed restaurant. Were always surprised at how quickly our food comes after weve ordered it. Especially considering its usually quite busy.\\nI love that its a fully vegan place, but I urge anyone, vegan or not, to try the food here and you wont be disappointed. Hopefully it may have even converted a few non-vegans ;)\\nThank you to the staff for always being so friendly and we look forward to coming here again soon :)

Great tasting pizza, but incredibly bad service in this particular restaurant.\\n\\nEdit: I emailed the team who replied to my review and they never responded. Tip for anyone who reads this: If you go to this restaurant and you get sat in the basement part of their restaurant, please try to get a different table sat upstairs where you might get treated better.

We just walked in for a quick drink, and we were welcomed by one of the three people working behind the bar with wait a second.\\nShe was counting some tips to give to the other people, which is fine, but one of the other staff could have served us.\\nThey had no problem serving the regular customers instead of us. We left after being ignored for 10 minutes. AVOID!!!
Great local pub. Good food and drinks. The salt and pepper chicken is amazing. They make great Espresso Martin. The staff is super nice and helpful. Lovely atmosphere.
A lovely old worldly pub. They did a few good ales and some nice ciders. The staff were all really friendly. Would recommend on a trip to London.

This place is a gem! Its a must visit if youre in/close to the area. The food was delicious, the service was on point, they couldnt do enough for you, and the ambience.....great atmosphere, quirky and great music! Definitely be back!
Amazing place! Really good product qualities. Very friendly the person attending. Super recommended
Excellent family-owned cafe with decadent handmade chocolate. Grab a delicious falafel wrap too while you‚Äôre at it!

Great food and lovely service. It is quite cheap (¬£8 for a main). Absolutely beautiful building and great garden. The only drawback is that menu isn‚Äôt very clear but recommended dishes were fabulous so who needs a menu?!\\n\\nEdit:\\nUnfortunately I had to change my previous review. Staff is still lovely and food is great but when it comes to paying I was presented with options ‚Äú15% tip, 20% tip, 25% tip, 30% tip or no tip at all‚Äù. Tipping 15% left me feeling cheap and under appreciating staff that was really great. I don‚Äôt know if management/owners eat out much but London standard is 12.5% service charge and leaving more is a sign of appreciation. In this case I felt like if I wanted to show my appreciation I would have to leave 25%-30% tip which I simply cannot afford (¬£20 for breakfast?). It is not only about the money you make but also how you make your guests feel. I felt cheap and like I can‚Äôt afford to say ‚Äúthank you‚Äù. Not the nicest feeling in the world.\\n\\nEdit of the edit:\\nThanks for your response! I am truly happy that you took the feedback on board. I am changing my rating back to 5 stars!

So glad to have found this gem! Couldn‚Äôt have been more impressed! Absolutely beautiful building with amazing decor and lots of plants inside, very Instagram friendly if that‚Äôs what you‚Äôre looking for.\\n\\nWe were greeted with amazing service, and they had great allergen knowledge and where happy to explain everything I could eat on the menu. Everything is vegan (so all dairy free) and they were able to make great gluten free substitutions. Best gluten free bread I‚Äôve ever had in a restaurant. And the vegan cheese, oh wow, It‚Äôs the first vegan cheese to fully satisfy this blue cheese lover!\\n\\nMy sister and mum enjoyed amazing warm pastry‚Äôs and couldn‚Äôt believe they were vegan. Even the drinks were lovely with  hot fresh apple with lots of cinnamon.\\n\\nAnd I would say all at a very reasonable price for the portions and quality you receive. Will definitely be a repeat customer

My first ever vegan restaurant meal. And as a staunch carnivore I was a little apprehensive - however I have to say I was very pleasantly surprised. I was at a wedding reception and the meal was set with four courses. I forgot to take photos I was enjoying it so much. The staff were absolutely delightful. This cafe is at the heart of the community offering opportunity for those with difficulties to gain skills for employment. Also classes on cooking on a budget. This place is a little gem and worth a visit. Ooh and they do lovely cocktails too
Intimate Restaurant, great menu with super polite and attentive staff.\\nHas a long history and have clearly got it right.\\nMay even bump into the odd celebrity.\\nLoved the honesty of the place

Traditional family run Greek Cypriot taverna, with typical food. Very friendly people who have been here a long time. We went at lunch where theres a daily special menu two courses ¬£11.50 plus drinks. Seemed to be a steady flow of regular locals, and some from overseas, so its popular. We shared mixed dips, and my wife tried the Mousaka, and I ordered chicken, all delicious. That probably wasnt very adventurous,  but it was our first visit, but we will definitely be returning to taste more. House wine is ¬£21/bottle.

Menu is exciting and has some items that are not in other greek restaurants.\\n\\nService was incredible, one of the family in particular - could not of been more helpful.\\n\\nThe food was delicious. This is a little gem! Great wine too.

The place gives a typical Indian feel and the staff was very friendly and responsive.\\nFood was very tasty and could feel the authentic flavours. Worth the price.\\nNot too expensive, very good food for moderate price.\\nI advise to reserve a table.\\nMutton chops - must try

First time in London & trying Indian food, and I could not be happier with my experience at Palms of Goa! The food was amazing and authentic, the restaurant was well-maintained and inviting, and Eugene and the whole staff were so kind and welcoming! Definitely recommend this wonderful restaurant to locals and tourists alike - cannot wait to return!

This was the first time we visited this restaurant and we would definitely go again. In fact, I think it was the best Indian meal I have ever had!\\n\\nThe service was great, the waiter was very attentive, but not overbearing.\\n\\nThe food was so tasty and the portion sizes were just right. Sometimes you are left feeling bloated, but we both felt it was just the right amount.\\n\\nWould definitely recommend and we would be happy to go back again!
Its a very nostalgic place for every Indian.\nThe afternoon tea has an Indian twist too. The staff are extremely hospitable and lovely.\nAmazing ambience.

Amazing high tea. Our family dietary requirements can be challenging, but Kona hit the mark with each off us. One put veggie, one veggie who eats eggs, one with allergies of eggs and nuts, and me who who will try anything.\\nThe setting was perfect, the staff very attentive and informative about the food when it was presented, and when it was presented, WOW it looked amazing and tasted exceptional. A great fusion of traditional English high tea with an Indian twist.\\nMarvelous, great work from the whole team, and many thanks for a giving us a truly wonderful time.
We went to have the Jasmin afternoon tea and the experience was fantastic.  Everything was delicious and the staff very friendly.  Highly recommended.  We will repeat.

Nice pub/bar with a good vibe. The staff are busy and work well with the amount of people ordering drinks, which are friendly. Food is nice but slow and portions leave a lot to be desired. Chips for ¬£5...? We expected a plate but a tiny little mug full is a bit ridiculous
Amazing food! We came for dinner after work and I think it‚Äôs one of the best meals I‚Äôve had this year. The pie and mash were so good I have to come back to try the Sunday lunch

The staff at Bonoo were amazing from the jump. We were greeted by the manager on arrival and made to feel very welcome. The food was outstanding, the service was 10/10. We were also offered complimentary mint tea after our dinner which was a lovely touch. We would recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for delicious authentic Indian food with great service. We will definitely be returning.

Came here for my mums birthday, the atmosphere is relaxed and the decor is cute, the food was absolutely delicious and the service was faultless. Really enjoyed the evening. Will definitely be coming back and recommending to family and friends. The meat and chicken was halal which was great as it meant lots more options. Thank you.

The food was excellent and the service was terrific. Some of the nicest people Ive eaten under. I am quite a good critic and I am hard to impress, but they were very very good. The food presentation is excellent, as is the taste of it. They were very nice especially because this was my mums birthday and they made it really special for her!

My sister & I had an amazing experience here Saturday. We did the bottomless cocktail tapas style afternoon tea and it was superb! I didnt get the name of our main server but he was lovely. All the staff were. The cocktails are amazing and they were very attentive in getting you a new one, so you really got your moneys worth for bottomless. The food was really good also. The red velvet cake was my favourite! I really liked the atmosphere, the jazz music really made the place. Overall, fantastic experience and highly recommend!

I had not had such an amazing afternoon tea for while. This little gem is the perfect place to come and relax. The food is to die for, I loved the very chilled music and the staff is super nice and pro. The cherry on the cake is that you can take your doggie there. I cant wait to go back

We went to MAP Mason for afternoon tea.  It was a very nice and unique experience as the tea was done in a tapas style.  The sandwiches were good and we got a cake each (at other afternoon teas these are usually shared).  The cocktails that accompanied the tea were really good.  The ambience of the place was lovely and it had nice decor.  Overall, very good!

Had the beef tacos to start, very tasty, followed by the prawn burger which was lovely and much lighter than a normal burger. My friend had the lamb shank and I must say, when it arrived, I had extreme food envy. It was apparently as good as it looked so will definitely try that next time. The Vegetarian cauliflower dish also got great reviews from my sister.
